newsitem.title: CHINA: HK STOCKS EXPECTED TO TREND DOWN, PROPERTIES WEAK.
newsitem.headline: HK STOCKS EXPECTED TO TREND DOWN, PROPERTIES WEAK.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks are expected to drift lower on Wednesday following an overnight plunge on Wall Street and worries over rising interest rates which have dampened sentiment of local property counters, brokers said.

"Properties are seen under pressure since there are signs that U.S. interest rates may rise and some local banks have already increased mortgage rates," said Peter So, deputy head of research at Schroder Securities. High interest rates could dampen flat sales and affect earnings of developers, he said.
The Dow tumbled 101.27 points, or 1.26 percent, to 7,960.84 on inflation fears fuelled by strong Redbook retail sales index.
"It will not be surprising if the Hang Seng falls 200 points today since the Dow industrials fell 100 points," said Peter Lui, institutional sales at NAVA SC Securities.
The blue chip Hang Seng Index ended 77.06 points lower on Tuesday at 16,383.41 but the Hang Seng London Reference Index later rose 25.79 points to close at 16,409.20.
But H-shares and red chips were likely to go firmer on hopes of a renewed round of asset injections and speculation on future restructuring in H-share companies, Lui said.
The H-share index jumped 76.27 points, or 5.62 percent, to close at 1,433.95 on Tuesday.
